title: 'Body reduced to skeletal frame': Rtd railway employee, daughter held in captivity; starved by servants
content: A shocking incident in Jhansi saw a retired railway employee and his mentally ill daughter allegedly held captive for five years by their servants. The father died from neglect, while the daughter was found severely malnourished. Relatives discovered the horrific conditions upon visiting after the father's death, leading to a police investigation into alleged property greed.

title: 'Treated as infiltrators': Congress' Adhir Ranjan Chowdhary meets PM Modi; flags 'violence against migrant workers'
content: Prime Minister Modi met Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury to discuss attacks on Bengali-speaking individuals in BJP-ruled states. Chowdhury highlighted administrative confusion between "Banglabhasi" and "Bangladeshi" people, leading to unjust detentions. This meeting precedes West Bengal's 2026 assembly elections, while Union Minister Amit Shah is also in the state reviewing BJP's poll preparedness.

title: Watch: CCTV captures moment when BEST bus ploughed into pedestrians in Mumbai; 4 dead
content: Tragedy struck Bhandup (West) railway station late Monday night as a BEST bus veered off course during a U-turn, crashing into pedestrians. The devastating incident claimed four lives and left ten others injured. CCTV footage captured the bus losing control, hitting a pole before mounting the footpath.

title: TOI's Indian Sportsperson of the Year: Women's World Cup team; three close contenders
content: FIELD OF DREAMS: In 2025, Harmanpreet Kaur, Smriti Mandhana, Deepti Sharma & their band of merry women learnt to believe. In doing so, they taught a thankful nation that when girls in India act on their vision, their wishes usually come true...

title: PAN-Aadhaar link status: How to check it & what happens if you miss Dec 31 deadline?
content: PAN-Aadhaar linking: The Income Tax Department allows PAN–Aadhaar linking through multiple online options and urges taxpayers to confirm their linking status to keep their PAN active. Failure to complete the process before the deadline could render PAN inoperative from January 1, 2026.

title: Deal gone wrong: US tech company drags acquisition adviser to court; alleges fee-driven bad advice
content: A tech firm, SmarTek21, is suing its advisor, TGP GP Management, alleging it was misled into a $5.2 million acquisition of IT Avalon. SmarTek21 claims TGP rushed the deal despite concerns about IT Avalon's finances, which have since required significant cash infusions. TGP, however, denies the allegations, asserting thorough due diligence and a strong business outlook for the combined entity.

title: Meals, refunds, baggage help: Over 100 flights hit as dense fog blankets Delhi; govt issues advisory
content: Amidst severe fog and low visibility impacting North India's flight operations, the Civil Aviation Ministry has directed airlines to strictly adhere to passenger facilitation norms. Passengers are urged to check flight statuses and allow extra travel time as 118 flights were cancelled and 16 diverted at Delhi airport.

title: Uttarakhand accident: 6 dead, several injured as bus falls into gorge in Almora
content: A passenger bus veered off the road and plunged into a deep gorge near Sailapani in Almora district on Tuesday, killing at least six people and injuring several others. The bus was traveling from Dwarahat to Ramnagar when the accident occurred, prompting a large-scale rescue operation amidst challenging terrain.

title: IND vs NZ: Bumrah, Hardik Pandya likely to be rested; ODI squad announcement soon
content: Jasprit Bumrah and Hardik Pandya are expected to be rested from the upcoming ODI series against New Zealand to ensure they are fresh for the T20 World Cup. Rishabh Pant might also be excluded from the ODI squad, with Ishan Kishan being a strong contender for a recall.

title: Chinese billionaire’s plan: Gaming tycoon fathered 100 children
content: Chinese billionaire Xu Bo reportedly aims to father at least 20 US-born children to inherit his $1.1 billion gaming fortune, bypassing domestic birth restrictions. This mirrors a trend among ultra-wealthy men like Pavel Durov and Elon Musk, who are also expanding their biological legacies through modern means.

title: Watch: Japanese tourists 'harassed' by locals at Varanasi ghat
content: Uttar Pradesh Congress chief Ajay Rai condemned the harassment of Japanese tourists in Varanasi, calling it shameful and a reflection of deteriorating law and order. He highlighted the incident in the Prime Minister's constituency as a sign of growing lawlessness and mob culture, urging a high-level investigation and strict action to protect tourists and India's reputation.

title: Who was Khaleda Zia? Bangladesh’s first woman PM; archrival of Sheikh Hasina
content: Former Bangladesh Prime Minister and BNP chairperson Khaleda Zia has died at the age of 80. A dominant political figure for decades and the country's first woman prime minister, Zia had been battling multiple serious health complications. Her death occurs as Bangladesh approaches crucial national elections.

title: Scary! Anthony Joshua stable after car crash that killed two; Nigeria President rings him
content: Former world heavyweight champion Anthony Joshua was hospitalized in Nigeria after a road accident that tragically claimed the lives of two friends and team members. Joshua sustained injuries but is in stable condition, with authorities suspecting excessive speed contributed to the crash involving a stationary truck.

title: Big AI bet: Mark Zuckerberg’s Meta makes its third-largest acquisition; buys AI firm with Chinese roots
content: Meta has acquired Chinese-rooted AI startup Manus for an undisclosed sum, marking its third-largest deal. This move fuels Mark Zuckerberg's aggressive AI push to compete with rivals like Google and OpenAI. Manus, known for its autonomous agents, will be integrated into Meta's products, including its AI chatbot, while continuing to operate its service.

title: Happy New Year 2026: Wishes, messages, wallpaper, pics and greetings
content: As 2026 approaches, the article highlights the diverse ways people celebrate and express New Year's wishes. It emphasizes the value of simple, heartfelt messages, relatable quotes, and genuine status updates, alongside visual elements like images and wallpapers, to connect with loved ones during this transitional period.

title: Trump says he'd 'love to fire' Fed chief Powell; hints at naming replacement next month
content: President Trump expressed his strong desire to dismiss Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, even contemplating legal action over alleged "gross incompetence."  While Trump has a preferred successor, he indicated no immediate rush for an announcement, hinting at a January reveal.  He previously considered firing Powell but was deterred by market reactions.

title: Kannada actress Nandini CM dies: Police probe suicide in Bengaluru; note cites family pressure
content: In a devastating incident, the film industry mourns the loss of 26-year-old Nandini CM, a South Indian actress celebrated for her role in 'Gauri.' Her untimely death by suicide in Bengaluru has shocked her fans and colleagues. Discovered in her shared living space, a note indicating personal battles and emotional challenges was found.

title: What attracts snakes to emerge from toilet bowls?
content: Snakes entering toilets are rare, driven by a search for shelter, moisture, or escape from flooding. They follow prey like rodents and insects into underground pipes, with toilets serving as accidental exits. While unsettling, these encounters are not planned attacks. Simple home maintenance can significantly reduce the already low risk.

title: 'We're heartbroken': 2 Telangana friends die in California accident
content: Two childhood friends from Telangana, Meghana Rani Pullakhandam (25) and Bhavana Kadiyala (24), tragically died in a road accident in Bishop, California on Sunday. The duo, who had completed their master's degrees in computer science in Ohio, were on a trip when their car veered off the road and fell into a gorge.

title: T20 World Cup snub: 'It's not the end of the road' — ex-India spinner backs Shubman Gill
content: Indian selectors have dropped Shubman Gill from the 2026 T20 World Cup squad, citing his recent form slump. Despite this, former spinner Harbhajan Singh believes it's not an end for Gill, highlighting the intense competition. Suryakumar Yadav retains captaincy, with selectors backing his ability to deliver. Axar Patel is vice-captain, and Ishan Kishan returns.

title: Delhi airport assault: Air India Express pilot arrested weeks after thrashing passenger
content: An Air India Express pilot, Captain Virender Sejwal, has been arrested for allegedly assaulting a passenger at Delhi's IGI Airport. The incident, which occurred on December 19, involved an altercation at a staff entry gate. The passenger, Ankit Dewan, later shared his experience on social media, leading to a government-ordered probe and the pilot being grounded.

title: Who is Kumar Mangalam Birla? Meet ‘KBC 17’ contestant, wife Neerja, & children
content: Billionaire Kumar Mangalam Birla recently graced 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17,' highlighting his influential family. His wife, Neerja, is a dedicated philanthropist and education trust chairperson. Their children, musician Ananya, psychology student Advaitesha championing women's health, and former cricketer Aryaman now managing businesses, have all carved their own successful paths, earning their father's immense pride.

title: Stefon Diggs looks for Cardi B after Patriots’ 42–10 win over Jets
content: New England Patriots star Stefon Diggs searched for his partner Cardi B after a decisive win against the New York Jets. This public display of affection garnered varied reactions online. Some praised the gesture as loving, while others questioned its authenticity. The couple had reportedly spent Christmas apart, making their reunion notable.

title: 'Radical Islamic terrorism': FBI arrests 'ISIS sympathiser'; attempted to provide explosives
content: An alleged ISIS sympathizer, 21-year-old John Michael Garza Jr., was arrested in Texas by the FBI. He is accused of attempting to provide bomb-making components and cryptocurrency to individuals he believed were acting for the terrorist group. Garza allegedly shared ISIS propaganda and offered instructions for building explosive devices.

title: Stephen Curry’s son Canon stuns fans with impressive dribbling skills
content: Stephen Curry's son, Canon, showcased remarkable dribbling skills during a Warriors game. The view captivated fans and the clip went viral. Comparisons to 'The Lion King's' Simba emerged, with many predicting a bright future for the young prodigy.  Canon, the youngest of Stephen and Ayesha Curry's four children, is already impressing with his talent.

title: 160 not out! Jurel knocks on ODI door: VHT blitz puts selectors on notice ahead of NZ series
content: Young wicketkeeper-batter Dhruv Jurel has made a compelling case for India's ODI squad with exceptional Vijay Hazare Trophy performances.  His recent unbeaten 160 off 101 balls, alongside over 300 runs in three matches, puts him firmly in contention for the upcoming New Zealand series, especially with Rishabh Pant's potential absence.

title: Bangladesh: Former PM Khaleda Zia dies at 80 in Dhaka; PM Modi, Yunus offer condolences
content: Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) chairperson and former Prime Minister Khaleda Zia has died at the age of 80. A dominant political figure for decades, Zia had been in critical condition for months. She served as prime minister twice, first becoming the nation's first female premier in 1991.

title: ‘We will knock them down’: Trump draws red line on Iran’s missile programme; Tehran fires back with warning
content: America's President Donald Trump has issued a stern warning to Iran. He stated that Iran will face severe repercussions if it attempts to revive its missile program. This comes amid reports of Iran potentially rebuilding its ballistic missile capabilities at new locations. Iran's advisor countered, vowing a strong response to any aggression. The US had previously targeted Iranian nuclear sites.

title: Karnataka: Man forces 3-year-old to drink alcohol at bar; excise dept steps in
content: A three-year-old boy was allegedly made to consume alcohol at a bar in Belagavi district, sparking outrage. The excise department has vowed action against Pritam Bar and Restaurant for allowing the minor and violating liquor laws. The elderly man responsible faces severe penalties under the Juvenile Justice Act.

title: Travis Kelce admits he let Andy Reid down amid Chiefs’ tough season
content: Kansas City Chiefs fans experienced an unfamiliar season of losses and missed playoffs in 2025, a stark contrast to years of dominance.  Veteran Travis Kelce expressed deep disappointment, feeling he let down coach Andy Reid, highlighting their strong bond and his unwavering sense of responsibility to the team and his mentor.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens below 25,950; BSE Sensex down over 100 points
content: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmark indices, Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, opened in red on Tuesday on weak global cues. While Nifty50 went below 25,950, BSE Sensex was down over 120 points.

title: 'Big discussion on West Bank': What went down at Trump & Netanyahu's meeting — key takeaways
content: President Trump and Prime Minister Netanyahu met at Mar-a-Lago, presenting a united front but revealing no concrete progress on the Gaza ceasefire's second phase. Trump made some contested claims about potential pardon for Netanyahu, which Israel's presidency disputed, whereas he also went on to issue warnings for Hamas and Iran.

title: Delhi air pollution: At 390, city's AQI in ‘very poor’ category; dense fog reduces visibility
content: Delhi started its day on Tuesday shrouded in heavy fog, which severely impaired visibility and created chaotic traffic conditions. The air quality dropped to alarming levels, reaching both 'very poor' and 'severe' status.

title: Tim Dillon questions Erika Kirk’s public appearances after Charlie Kirk tragedy
content: Tim Dillon questioned Erika Kirk’s public appearances after reports about Charlie Kirk, saying people feel confused. On his podcast, he discussed her merch events and her interview with Nicki Minaj at America Fest. Erika Kirk defended her actions, continued leading Turning Point USA, and reassured Minaj during their on-stage conversation.

title: MLB trade rumors: Mets eye $10M Phillies star; Brandon Nimmo in focus
content: The New York Mets are reportedly signing veteran outfielder Max Kepler to a one-year deal, aiming for a cost-effective solution after trading Brandon Nimmo. Kepler offers defensive reliability and left-handed power, fitting the Mets' strategy of maintaining roster stability and payroll flexibility while preparing for top prospect Carson Benge's eventual rise.

title: 'Sat on his chest': Retired IAF engineer murdered by daughter-in-law
content: A shocking incident unfolded in Delhi's Bindapur area where a retired Air Force engineer, Naresh Kumar, was allegedly murdered by his daughter-in-law, Geeta. A property dispute over a 50-yard plot is believed to be the motive. Geeta reportedly sat on the victim's chest, causing fatal head injuries. Neighbours raised the alarm after hearing his cries.

title: 'Limited military op': Saudi bombs Yemeni port; targets alleged arms shipment arrived from UAE
content: Saudi Arabia bombed Yemen's Mukalla port, targeting UAE-supplied weapons for separatists. This strike escalates tensions between Riyadh and Abu Dhabi, who back opposing factions in Yemen's war. The attack follows recent Saudi warnings to separatists to halt advances, highlighting growing friction between the Gulf allies over regional influence.

title: 'Dhurandhar' BO collection Day 25: Ranveer starrer scores Rs 1078 cr worldwide haul
content: Dhurandhar, the spy-thriller starring Ranveer Singh and Akshaye Khanna, is a massive box office success. The film has crossed Rs 701 crore in India and Rs 1078 crore worldwide. It has surpassed Kalki 2898 AD and Pathaan in collections. Dhurandhar is now chasing Jawan's lifetime earnings and is set to become the biggest Bollywood grosser.

title: 2 Mondays, a year apart: BEST bus mows down 4, injures 14 in Mumbai; driver suspended
content: Bhandup West faced a devastating tragedy when a BEST bus driver, during a U-turn, lost control, resulting in the tragic deaths of four individuals and injuries to fourteen pedestrians. The electric AC bus careened off the road, striking a pole before impacting innocent bystanders.

title: Another US strike, two more dead: Anti-drug campaign toll crosses 100 — watch
content: US forces killed two suspected "male narco-terrorists" in a strike on an alleged drug-smuggling boat in the Eastern Pacific. This brings the total killed in Washington's campaign to at least 107. The military claims intelligence confirmed the vessel's involvement in drug trafficking, though evidence for the strikes remains unprovided, sparking debate over legality.

title: Just 62 runs away: Smriti Mandhana set to surpass Shubman Gill; this record in sight
content: Mandhana’s run-scoring at the top of the order has played a key role in India Women’s results this season. She has scored runs in different formats and conditions while setting up innings for the team.

title: 'Where are the captains?': AI, IndiGo in dogfight for pilots; joining bonus up to Rs 50 lakh
content: As Indian airlines face a dwindling pool of pilots due to updated flight duty regulations, IndiGo and Air India are ramping up their recruitment efforts. IndiGo, in particular, is set to hire 100 new pilots this January, with captains receiving enticing signing bonuses that could soar to ₹50 lakh.

title: Who were Latif Ayodele and Sina Ghami? Tragedy strikes Anthony Joshua
content: Anthony Joshua is recovering in hospital after a fatal road crash in Nigeria claimed the lives of two of his closest friends, Latif Ayodele and Sina Ghami. The pair were integral members of his team, serving as personal trainer and strength coach. Joshua survived the collision and remains in a stable condition as investigations continue.

title: First land strike? US hits drug boat loading facility in Venezuela; tensions set to rise
content: President Trump revealed a US operation targeting a drug loading area in Venezuela, marking a potential escalation in land-based actions.  He described a "major explosion" hitting boats and the implementation site.  Details remain scarce, with US agencies and the Venezuelan government declining comment, fueling speculation about covert activities amid a significant Caribbean military buildup.

title: Social media storm over politicians’ English proficiency triggers debate in Kerala
content: Heated debate sparked by viral memes mocking Parliamentarian A.A. Rahim, national president of DYFI, during a recent visit to Bengaluru. Following the demolition of illegal structures, Rahim acknowledged his need to enhance his language skills but emphasised the importance of his empathy towards those displaced

title: BMC polls: RPI(A)’s exclusion from BJP, Shiv Sena seat-sharing a ‘betrayal of trust’, says Athawale
content: The deadline to file nomination papers for the January 15 polls for 29 municipal corporations in Maharashtra closes on December 30

title: Congress leader Adhir meets PM Modi over attacks on Bangla-speaking migrants
content: The Congress leader urged the Prime Minister to "sensitise all the state governments" against discrimination, violence, and persecution of migrant labourers from other parts of the country.

title: Atleast six killed as bus falls into gorge in Uttarakhand’s Almora
content: The accident occurred in the Bhikiyasain area when the bus was en route to Ramnagar in Nainital, officials from the State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) said

title: Major fire guts several shops in Kochi’s Broadway
content: No casualty was reported though the blaze is estimated to have caused losses to the tune of lakhs of rupees

title: What India did to protect its forests and hills in 2025: from Kancha Gachibowli to Aravalli
content: Citizens’ protest to protect environment, their ancestral land, judicial orders impacting natural resources: what Indians are doing to protect their environment

title: Six hospitalised after heavy rush at rapper Vedan’s concert in Kerala’s Kasaragod
content: Police said the crowd swelled unexpectedly late in the night during the concert, overwhelming security arrangements.

title: HAL’s Dhruv NG multi-role helicopter takes maiden flight in Bengaluru
content: Designed and manufactured by Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL), the Dhruv NG is 5.5-tonne, light twin-engine, multi-role helicopter.

title: Three fishermen from Rameswaram arrested by Sri Lankan Navy; trawler impounded
content: V.P. Jesu Raja, leader of a fishermen association, condemned the arrest, stating that the persistent appeals from Tamil Nadu’s fishermen had been ignored

title: Tripura student killing: NHRC issues notice to Dehradun DM, SSP
content: Leaders cutting across political lines called for comprehensive efforts to end "hate crimes" against the people from the northeastern states

title: Fog disrupts Delhi airport ops; 118 flights cancelled, 16 diverted
content: In a post on X in the morning, Delhi Airport said all flight operations continue as normal, and flights that are not CAT III compliant may get affected

title: Kerala Congress leader and former MLA P.M. Mathew passes away
content: P.M. Mathew, who represented Kaduthuruthy Assembly constituency from 1991 to 1996, was closely associated for long with Kerala Congress (M) leader K.M. Mani

title: Dense fog shrouds Delhi; air quality lets up, 'very poor' with AQI 388
content: The outlook for the subsequent six days indicates that air quality is likely to stay in the ‘very poor’ range

title: Sabarimala gold theft case: SIT to grill Dindigal-based businessman with alleged links to illegal antique trade
content: Officials said SIT had interviewed the businessperson, who allegedly goes by several aliases, including D. Mani, in his office last week. The SIT yet is to name him as an accused in the case

title: How the moon kicked Chandrayaan-3 propulsion module into a new orbit
content: ISRO left the Chandrayaan-3 propulsion module in a wide earth orbit that grazed the moon’s neighbourhood, and there began the adventure

title: What is the India-New Zealand Free Trade Agreement? | Explained
content: What zero-duty access will India get, and how much FDI is New Zealand committing to by 2030? Which sectors in New Zealand have criticised the deal? Why is India accelerating FTAs with countries? How will labour-intensive sectors like textiles, leather, gems, and processed foods benefit?

title: Bihar Minister’s appointment as Assistant Professor put on hold due to shortcomings
content: Sources said that due to the discrepancy over his name, the appointment of Ashok Choudhary who is Minister in the Bihar government has been withheld. Last year in June, he was selected for the post of Assistant Professor in political science in Pataliputra University

title: Haryana BJP Ministers inaugurate library building twice separately, bringing into open the infighting within the party
content: The conflict between the two leaders is nothing new and the duo had allegedly exchanged barbs during a debate on stage in 2018

title: Gujarat tops in okra production
content: In 2024–25, okra cultivation expanded across 12 districts of Saurashtra and Kutch, covering around 14,000 hectares and yielding close to 1.5 lakh tonnes

title: Indore police questions migrant workers on allegations of being Bangladeshi; documents being verified
content: According to the police, a complaint was received at the Malharganj police station from some residents of Kamla Nagar area alleging that a group of workers at a cloth factory were illegal Bangladeshi immigrants

title: Day after Dr. Abdullah opposed students’ protest, NC legislator says ‘should have been allowed’
content: Sadiq’s statement came as a U-turn on the stand taken by Dr. Abdullah, who questioned the intention of the leaders who wanted to join protests in Srinagar

title: Amit Shah to visit West Bengal for three days ahead of 2026 polls
content: Between December 29 and December 31, Mr Shah is also expected to chair several meetings with the State unit of the BJP and review the party’s roadmap and preparedness for the upcoming elections

title: Congress suspends Aravalli agitation in Rajasthan after SC decision
content: Pradesh Congress Committee president Govind Singh Dotasra said the Supreme Court’s order depicted respect for people’s voice and was a “decisive blow to the mining mafia” operating in the Aravalli hills

title: About 170 sheep mysteriously die in Lucknow, police sends samples for testing
content: Prima facie, it is not clear whether these sheep died after consuming waste material or some unknown person had allegedly given poison to them

title: Chaos at SIR hearings as Trinamool demands inclusion of booth level agents during proceedings
content: Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari asked for an FIR to be filed against the Trinamool MLA who stopped the hearing in Chinsurah over this issue

title: Indian naval sailing vessel Kaundinya sails on maiden overseas voyage to Oman
content: The Navy informed that the historic expedition marks a significant milestone in India’s endeavour to revive, understand and celebrate its ancient maritime heritage through a living ocean voyage

title: India rejects Pakistan’s remarks on minorities
content: Pakistan’s “horrific and systemic victimisation” of minorities of various faiths is a well-established fact, says External Affairs Ministry spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal.

title: KSRTC’s city ride a draw in the New Year season
content: The rides, between 3 p.m. and 10 p.m. at hourly intervals, start from East Fort, and covers prominent areas like Palayam, Museum, Kanakakkunnu, Vellayambalam, Kowdiar, Pattoor, Chakkai, Thiruvananthapuram International Airport, BrahMos Aerospace, Shanghumughom, and LuLu Mall

title: A.P. Cabinet clears district reorganisation, mandal realignment
content: Reorganisation affects 17 districts with 25 adjustments; Polavaram and Markapuram added, taking total districts to 28 after public consultation and gazette notification

title: Not satisfied with India’s response to Myanmar polls, say anti-junta rebels
content: India has been calling for inclusive election in Myanmar but rebel groups urge New Delhi to exert more pressure on the junta to make the election truly inclusive

title: Unnao rape case: Congress welcomes Supreme Court stay on Sengar's sentence suspension
content: Congress leader Alka Lamba described the stay as a victory for the rape survivor and her supporters, asserting that the legal battle would continue

title: Defence Acquisition Committee gives its nod for defence purchases worth ₹79,000 crore
content: Approval accorded for the Army’s proposal for radars and guided rocket ammunition; Navy’s request for tugs and high frequency radio, and Air Force’s proposal for missiles, simulators

title: Vice-President C.P. Radhakrishnan highlights role of festivals in strengthening unity and inclusive growth
content: Christmas, he said, is not just for those who practice the faith but for all good people who want to create a positive and vibrant society.

title: Opposition condemns harassment of Japanese tourists over attire in U.P.
content: A video of the incident triggers social media debate on hospitality towards foreign visitors, with users noting that such incidents never occurred before in the ‘spiritual city with pluralistic identity’. The Opposition blames the ‘culture of intolerance’ practised by the BJP government for such the incident.

title: Hyderabad region gets fourth Police Commissionerate, officials transferred
content: Future City Commissionerate established and Rachakonda Commissionerate is reorganised and renamed; Yadadri now a separate district police unit, officers transferred

title: ‘Dravidian Model’ govt 2.0 will implement improved schemes for women: CM Stalin
content: The DMK’s election manifesto will have new schemes devised under the leadership of the party’s deputy general secretary and Parliamentary Party leader, Kanimozhi, he says in his address at the party’s west zone women’s conference, titled ‘Vellum Tamil Pengal’

title: For AI summit in February, government eyes G20 levels of participation
content: With over a dozen foreign leaders and other functionaries in attendance, the groundwork for the AI Impact Summit in February has been underway since early 2025, when France hosted the AI Action Summit

title: DRDO successfully tests 120-km strike range Pinaka rockets
content: Defence Acquisition Council clears the planned procurement proposals worth Rs 79,000 crore, including Long Range Guided Rockets-120.

title: How many families were affected by the Kogilu demolition? Surveys differ
content: Surveys conducted by an NGO, by Housing Corporation, and by local leaders have shown different figures

title: Confrontation near madrasa in J&K leads to stone pelting, injuries; one man arrested
content: The police said a First Information Report under Sections 125, 125(a), 191(2) of the BNS was registered. “Investigation has been taken up accordingly,” the police said

title: Congress urges PM Modi to act against rising hate crimes targeting Christians
content: Congress general secretary (organisation) K.C. Venugopal in a letter to PM Modi says disruptions to Christmas celebrations across the country are not isolated incidents but ‘scars on the core idea of India’

title: Mysuru commuters oppose use of ageing BMTC buses for city services
content: KSRTC official says that around 1,520 buses has been refurbished so far at the corporation’s regional and divisional workshops across the State, adding that the refurbishment programme has won several awards for innovation and sustainability

title: Supreme Court order a temporary relief, fight will continue, says Unnao rape survivor’s lawyer
content: Yogita Bhayan, founder of Pari, who has been protesting alongside the survivor, says the Supreme Court has restored her faith in the judiciary

title: Mandya saw more than half of all communal riots in Karnataka over two years
content: Traditionally not a communally-sensitive region, Mandya has seen an escalation in communal conflicts in recent times, particularly after the BJP-JD(S) alliance, say observers

title: ED files third complaint against wife of prime accused in Singh DTO case
content: The ED has seized about 268.22 Bitcoin, valued at ₹130 crore, based on disclosures by Parvinder Singh. Prosecution complaints were filed against the brothers last year

title: Disaster Waste Management Protocol notified by Kerala govt.
content: The protocol prepared by Suchitwa Mission clarifies the roles and responsibilities of departments in waste management during disasters

title: No let-up in harassment of Kashmiri shawl sellers in Himachal Pradesh: JKSA
content: The JKSA has urged Leader of the Opposition Rahul Gandhi, and Chief Minister of Himachal Pradesh, Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu to intervene immediately

title: Three police inspectors suspended after inter-State drug seizure; journalist booked for extortion
content: The disciplinary action followed a high-profile operation led by the Maharashtra Anti-Narcotics Task Force (ANTF), in coordination with the Bengaluru Police and the Narcotics Control Department, which resulted in the seizure of a large drug consignment

title: 2025 a breakthrough year for economic growth, welfare of A.P., claims Andhra Pradesh Cabinet
content: Meeting reviews NDA government's performance in the year, highlights achievements like welfare outlays exceeding ₹50,000 crore benefiting various sections, recruitment of 15,941 teachers and 5,757 police personnel, MoUs for ₹13.25 lakh crore investments and double-digit GDP growth

title: 2 Kashmiri vendors face harassment in Haryana; FIR filed
content: In the video emerging from Kaithal’s Kalayat, a local man speaking in Haryanvi dialect is heard confronting the vendor sitting on a concrete bench asking him to chant “Vande Matram”

title: Demanding higher MSP, farmers dump red gram on road
content: They criticise State government for procuring red gram only at MSP fixed by the Centre without providing any additional incentive

title: CPI(M) protests at CRDA office seeking justice for Amaravati farmer
content: Party demands ₹50 lakh assistance to Ramarao’s family, rectification of plot allotments and fulfilment of assurances to farmers and residents of the capital region

title: Nuggets' Jokic limps off court after injuring knee
content: Nuggets star Nikola Jokic limped off the court at halftime of Denver's game in Miami on Monday night after injuring his left knee with about three seconds left before the intermission. He will have an MRI on Tuesday.

title: Robinson rolls up 229 total yards, Falcons soar
content: Veteran running back Bijan Robinson had a career-high 195 yards rushing on 22 carries, and another 34 yards receiving on five receptions Monday night as the Atlanta Falcons authored a 27-24 victory over the Los Angeles Rams at Mercedes-Benz Stadium.

title: Chargers rest Herbert; Lance to start vs. Broncos
content: The Chargers will rest quarterback Justin Herbert for Sunday's regular-season finale, with Trey Lance getting the start against the Broncos.

title: Riley won't return as Clemson OC after 7-6 season
content: Two days after the season ended with a 22-10 loss to Penn State in the Pinstripe Bowl, Clemson coach Dabo Swinney announced Monday that offensive coordinator Garrett Riley and safeties coach Mickey Conn will not return to the Tigers' program next season.

title: Ex-boxing champ Joshua hurt in crash, two killed
content: Former world heavyweight champion Anthony Joshua was hospitalized in Nigeria after being involved in a car crash that killed two people who were team members.

title: Tiger turns 50, now eligible for Champions tour
content: Tiger Woods turned 50 on Tuesday, making the 15-time major championship winner eligible to compete on the PGA Tour Champions circuit once he recovers from his latest health setbacks.

title: Father of NASCAR's Hamlin dies after house fire
content: Denny Hamlin's father died and his mother was critically injured after a weekend fire heavily damaged the North Carolina home where they lived.

title: DE Jacobs, No. 11 in ESPN 300, picks Ohio State
content: Two days before Ohio State opens its College Football Playoff run with a quarterfinal bout against Miami, Ryan Day and the Buckeyes got a five-star commitment Monday from 2027 defensive end D.J. Jacobs, the No. 11 overall prospect in the ESPN Junior 300.

title: 🏈 26 QBs to watch in CFB transfer portal
content: From top targets to top backups, we've tiered QBs ahead of the transfer portal officially opening Jan. 2.

title: Our NBA cheat sheet for 2026: Big questions, awards picks and All-NBA rosters

title: 'Profound Loss For Bangladesh': Sheikh Hasina Pays Tribute To Khaleda Zia
content: Bangladesh's deposed prime minister Sheikh Hasina expressed condolences over the death of her archrival Khaleda Zia, who dominated the country's politics alongside her for decades.

title: 2025 Was One Of Three Hottest Years On Record: Scientists
content: Temperatures remained high despite the presence of a La Nina, the occasional natural cooling of Pacific Ocean waters that influences weather worldwide. Researchers cited the continued burning of fossil fuels that send greenhouse gases into atmosphere

title: Protests, Candle Light Vigils Continue In Tripura Over Anjel Chakma's Death
content: Candle light vigils, rallies and protests continue in several parts of Tripura over the death of the 24-year-old student Anjel Chakma in Dehradun.

title: On Camera, Warden Assaults Student, Hits Her With Stick At Telangana Hostel
content: There has been no official statement so far on whether a case has been registered against the warden or whether departmental action has been initiated.

title: Bihar Temple Theft Case: Priceless Idols Recovered After 24-Hour Excavation
content: The investigation into the multi-crore theft at the famous Thawe Durga Temple in Bihar's Gopalganj has taken a dramatic turn, leaving both police officials and the people stunned.

title: 'On Its Way': Trump On Pardon For 'Wartime PM' Netanyahu, Israel Says...
content: US President Donald Trump said on Monday that Israeli President Isaac Herzog had told him a pardon for Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu was "on its way," an assertion Herzog's office was quick to challenge.

title: Illness For Trump, Defeat For Maduro: Peru Witch Doctors' 2026 Prediction
content: Shamans in Peru gathered for an annual New Year's ritual on Monday where they made predictions for the year to come, including illness for US President Donald Trump and the downfall of Venezuelan counterpart Nicolas Maduro.

title: Battle Of Begums: All About Rivalry Between Khaleda Zia And Sheikh Hasina

title: UP Store Staff Locks Customer Inside Room, Assaults Him Over Billing Issue

title: Nikki Haley's Son Calls For Complete H-1B Visa Ban Amid Stamping Delays
content: Hundreds of H-1B visa holders recently travelled to India to complete visa stamping. When they reached India for their appointments in January, many were told their dates had been postponed for a long time.

title: Priyanka Gandhi's Son Raihan Vadra Engaged To Longtime Girlfriend Aviva Baig
content: Raihan Vadra, the son of Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi and businessman Robert Vadra, is now engaged to his longtime girlfriend, Aviva Baig.
